page.title: 12BARNSTON VILLAGE AND CHURCH
page.content: Barnston Village has hardly changed in the last hundred years. There a few large houses,some picturesque cottages,a public house, several farms along the A551 and of course the village church Christchurch. The church,which was a hundred years old in 1971,was built from the silvery red sandstone of nearby Storeton Quarry in a "Gothic Revival"style. The Day School,on the same site and erected in 1870,was the village school for 80 years and is now the church hall. Our new Vicar lives in the vicarage behind the Church.He came to Barnston in 1984.He keeps his car in the coachouse which used to hold horses and carts. The Church,vicarage,old school and coachouse were all built around 1871.
